posts.post_content:
Considering using this with [Catalyst Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Catalyst Stone) and cards to get the Stone in play such as [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker). Then I would use [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves )  to protect Dralnu from getting damaged from most sources. Then I would use cards with dredge such as [Darkblast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darkblast) to get targets to cast into my graveyard. I would either try to flashback or hard cast a [Morality Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Morality Shift) to get many targets into my graveyard. In the deck I would have large spells such as [Plague Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Wind ) or [Wit's End](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wit's End) that I might not normally play.
  
Cinsider this, Dralnu in play, use Tinker and sac a cheap artifact such as [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter )  or [Seat of the Synod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seat of the Synod ) to get the Catalyst stone into play, now target the Tinker in my graveyard with Dralnu and pay one blue (the cost of Tinker reduced by 2) to get another Catalyst Stone into play. Now flashback is reduced by 4 for ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: TreeTrunkMaster (11/22/2009 11:15:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've built an entire extended archetype around this card, with amazing matchups against nearly the entire field. Then the format became New Extended.  
Use this with fog effects, with Luminesce and Safe Passage main to protect from burn. Play like turbo fog at first, with howling mines, etc. Eventually get Dralnu out, and recur fogs pretty much forever. Mark of Asylum can protect Dralnu, and you finish either with constant milling or through a pair of Luminarch Ascension.   
It beat Thopter/Depths reliably, as they rarely had burn. It could easily beat most combo decks thanks to things like Luminesce. Zoo was annoying, but still reliably winnable, as their burn was hated out main deck and otherwise they couldn't really do anything.   
It was really great. Pity Dralnu isn't even Extended legal anymore.
posts.html:

It beat Thopter/Depths reliably, as they rarely had burn. It could easily beat most combo decks thanks to things like Luminesce. Zoo was annoying, but still reliably winnable, as their burn was hated out main deck and otherwise they couldn't really do anything.
It was really great. Pity Dralnu isn't even Extended legal anymore.

posts.post_content:
This guy can make for some fun times.
  
   
But I highly recommend equiping him with [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) or something to shroud him. Otherwise a simple [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) can set your board position back a good three or so turns.

Posted By: DarthParallax (11/3/2012 4:57:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Th3\_Dark\_On3: This comes from the unhinged FAQTIWDAWCC, so it's a bit...  
  
But regardless, [Blast from the Past](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blast from the Past) is the only card on which Buyback and Flashback can normally interact: The flashback is a self-replacement effect meaning that the card will be removed from the game before buyback would return it to your hand.
posts.html:
@Th3_Dark_On3: This comes from the unhinged FAQTIWDAWCC, so it's a bit...

But regardless, Blast from the Past is the only card on which Buyback and Flashback can normally interact: The flashback is a self-replacement effect meaning that the card will be removed from the game before buyback would return it to your hand.

posts.post_content:
Look at this guy.  
LOOK AT HIM  
You TELL me he isn't the most fitting EDH general ever.  
That art، that cape, that smug stance. And if he's going down, da. mned if he isn't taking your entire field with him.  
I mean for crap's sake, he may be a wizard now but he has LORD written on his subtype line.  
He is built to rule over your B/U control deck.  
  
I'm building a mostly innistrad/DA Zombie swarm control deck, he's at the helm like a boss.  
It could be grimgrin. It could be Mikaeus, The Unhallowed. No, it's him, because I want to counter kill everything.  
Let's just hope I can get [magebane armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=magebane armor), so I don't have to kill myself thanks to burn.

posts.post_content:
I have a feeling that this card would be run a LOT more if it didn't have its drawback. But here's the thing. In EDH, no one runs burn for spot removal. Sometimes a card like Blasphemous Act will be played, but even in that event, you are probably running a deck with a few sac outlets. Given that, this thing is like a Havengul Lich for spells.  
  
Do it like a man. Equip a Sword and swing in for balls factor.
